title: Renaissance-Grotesk?
content:
Has someone of you ever heard about an old lead type called Renaissance-Grotesk?  
Its a condensed Grotesk.  
This was the name on the label of the case.  
I’m not sure if its right.  
For my opinion, better: feeling, there is a logical break between Rennaissance and a Grotesk font, isn’t it?

Georg

 [‹ Camilla Lowther serif logotype](http://web.archive.org/web/20080306071918/http:/typophile.com/node/42383 "Go to previous forum topic") [Old Sci-fi mag/book covers ID ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080306071918/http:/typophile.com/node/42393 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Bleisetzer

comments.content: Maybe someone who reads German can [help](http://web.archive.org/web/20080306071918/http:/www.typo-online.ch/tds/2006/bericht.html). It [seems](http://web.archive.org/web/20080306071918/http:/www.google.com/search?q=Renaissance-Grotesk) to be related somehow to Renaissance Antiqua, which was designed by Zapf, so maybe Renaissance Grotesk was also designed by him.
